intro: Primula calderiana var. strumosa, commonly known as the Strumose Primula, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant features a basal rosette of velvety, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
